Type.Name: NetworkStream
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Implements the standard stream mechanism to read and write network data through an instance of the class.

remarks.para: The class allows network data to be read and written in the same manner as the class.
This class supports simultaneous synchronous and asynchronous access to the network data. Random access is not supported and thus the property always returns
The following properties and methods inherited from the class are not supported and throw a exception when accessed:
The method is reserved for future use but does not throw an exception.

summary.para: Begins an asynchronous operation to read data from the current instance.

returns.para: A instance that contains information about the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para:
To retrieve the results of the operation and release resources allocated by the method, call the method, and specify the object returned by this
method.

para.block: The method should be called exactly once for each call to the method.

remarks.para: If the parameter is not , the method referenced by is invoked when the asynchronous operation completes. The object returned by this method is passed as the argument to the method referenced by . The method referenced by can retrieve the results of the operation by calling the method.

The parameter can be any object that the caller wishes to have available for the duration of the asynchronous operation. This object is available via the
property of the object returned by this method.

Docs.exception: is .

exception.para: An error occurred while accessing the underlying socket.

para.block: Any exception thrown by the method is caught and rethrown as an with the original exception stored in the property.

Docs.exception: The current instance has been disposed.

example.para: For an outline of an asynchronous operation, see the method. For the complete example, see the class overview.

method.

para.block: The method should be called exactly once for each call to the method.

remarks.para: If the parameter is not , the method referenced by is invoked when the asynchronous operation completes. The object returned by this method is passed as the argument to the method referenced by . The method referenced by can retrieve the results of the operation by calling the method.

The parameter can be any object that the caller wishes to have available for the duration of the asynchronous operation. This object is available via the
property of the object returned by this method.

Docs.exception: is .

para.block: Any exception thrown by the method is caught and rethrown as an with the original exception stored in the property.

The value of this property is initially set by the constructors.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual void Close()
public override void Close ();

summary.para: Closes the stream and, if owned by the current instance, the underlying socket.

remarks.para: This method calls ( ), which frees both managed and unmanaged resources used by the current instance. When the underlying socket is owned by the current instance, the method of the socket is called, which frees both managed and unmanaged resources used by the socket.

block.para: Ownership of a socket is specified using the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Close (int timeout);

Docs.param: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: .property bool DataAvailable { public hidebysig virtual specialname bool get_DataAvailable() }
public virtual bool DataAvailable { get; }

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether data is available to be read from the underlying socket buffer.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.

para.block: Accessing this property causes a call to the method of the underlying instance. If the method returns a non-zero value, indicating data is available to be read, this property returns ; otherwise, this property returns .
Override this property to determine if data is available to be read in the underlying socket buffer.

Docs.exception: The current instance has been disposed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method family hidebysig virtual void Dispose(bool disposing)
protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);

Docs.param: A . Specify to release both managed and unmanaged resources; specify to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.para: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the current instance and optionally releases the managed resources.

block.para: Ownership of a socket is specified using the constructor.
The method calls this method with the parameter set to . The finalizer calls this method with the parameter set to .

para.block: This method closes the current instance releasing all unmanaged resources allocated by the current instance. When the underlying socket is owned by the current instance, the method of the socket is called, which frees the managed and unmanaged resources used by the socket. When the parameter is , this method also releases all resources held by any other managed objects allocated by the current instance.

This method closes the current instance releasing all unmanaged resources allocated by the current instance. When the underlying socket is owned by the current instance, the method of the socket is called, which frees the managed and unmanaged resources used by the socket.
The method can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding this method, do not reference objects that have been previously disposed in an earlier call.
Use this method to release resources allocated by the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual int32 EndRead(class System.IAsyncResult asyncResult)
public override int EndRead (IAsyncResult ar);

Docs.param: A object that holds the state information for the asynchronous operation.

summary.para: Ends an asynchronous call to read data from the current instance.

returns.para: A containing the number of bytes read from the stream.

remarks.para: This method blocks if the asynchronous operation has not completed.

The method completes an asynchronous request that was started with a call to the method. The object specified for the parameter is required to be the same object as was returned by the method call that began the request.
If the method is invoked via the delegate specified to the method, the parameter is the argument passed to the delegate's method.

Docs.exception: is .

An error occurred while accessing the underlying socket.
This method catches all exceptions thrown by the method.
The current instance has been disposed.

example.para: For an outline of an asynchronous operation, see the method. For the complete example, see the class overview.

remarks.para: This method blocks if the asynchronous operation has not completed.

The method completes an asynchronous request that was started with a call to the method. The object specified for the parameter is required to be the same object as was returned by the method call that began the request.
If the method is invoked via the delegate specified to the method, the parameter is the argument passed to the delegate's method.

Docs.exception: is .

An error occurred while accessing the underlying socket.
This method catches all exceptions thrown by the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method family hidebysig virtual void Finalize()
~NetworkStream ();

summary.para: Frees unmanaged resources used by the current instance.

block.para: Application code does not call this method; it is automatically invoked during garbage collection unless finalization by the garbage collector has been disabled. For more information, see , and .

This method calls (), which frees unmanaged resources used by the current instance. When the underlying socket is owned by the current instance, it is closed and the managed and unmanaged resources used by the socket are freed.
Ownership of a socket is specified using the constructor.

public override void Flush ();

summary.para: This method is reserved for future use.

remarks.para: Calling this method does not throw an exception.

summary.para: Throws a .

block.para: The base class implements this property to return the length of the data available on the stream. This functionality is not supported in the class.

Docs.exception: Any attempt to access this property.

block.para: The base class implements this property to return or set the current position in the stream. This functionality is not supported in the class.

Docs.exception: Any attempt to access this property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual int32 Read(class System.Byte[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 size)
public override int Read (byte[] buffer, int offset, int size);

Docs.param: A array to store data read from the stream.
A containing the zero-based position in at which to begin storing the data.
A containing the number of bytes to read.

summary.para: Reads data from the current instance and stores it in a data buffer.

returns.para: A containing the number of bytes read from the stream.

remarks.para: When no incoming data is available, this method blocks and waits for data to arrive.
If the remote socket was shut down gracefully ( was called on the socket or the option was enabled and was called on the socket) and all data was received, this method immediately returns zero.

Docs.exception: is .

An error occurred while accessing the underlying socket.
This method catches all exceptions thrown by the method.
The current instance has been disposed.

summary.para: Writes data from a specific area of a data buffer to the current instance.

remarks.para: When no buffer space is available within the underlying protocol, this method blocks unless the socket is in non-blocking mode.
